sentence: Looking at the universe of stocks we cover at Dividend Channel , on 4/19/17, Procter & Gamble Co. (Symbol: PG), Colgate-Palmolive Co. (Symbol: CL), and CVS Health Corporation (Symbol: CVS) will all trade ex-dividend for their respective upcoming dividends.

Procter & Gamble Co. will pay its quarterly dividend of $0.6896 on 5/15/17, Colgate-Palmolive Co. will pay its quarterly dividend of $0.40 on 5/15/17, and CVS Health Corporation will pay its quarterly dividend of $0.50 on 5/1/17.

As a percentage of PG's recent stock price of $90.45, this dividend works out to approximately 0.76%, so look for shares of Procter & Gamble Co. to trade 0.76% lower - all else being equal - when PG shares open for trading on 4/19/17.
Similarly, investors should look for CL to open 0.54% lower in price and for CVS to open 0.64% lower, all else being equal.
Below are dividend history charts for PG, CL, and CVS, showing historical dividends prior to the most recent ones declared.
In general, dividends are not always predictable, following the ups and downs of company profits over time.
Therefore, a good first due diligence step in forming an expectation of annual yield going forward, is looking at the history above, for a sense of stability over time.
This can help in judging whether the most recent dividends from these companies are likely to continue.
If they do continue, the current estimated yields on annualized basis would be 3.05% for Procter & Gamble Co., 2.17% for Colgate-Palmolive Co., and 2.56% for CVS Health Corporation.
In Monday trading, Procter & Gamble Co. shares are currently up about 0.5%, Colgate-Palmolive Co. shares are up about 0.3%, and CVS Health Corporation shares are up about 0.1% on the day.
